doc:
S. Z. Sakall https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S._Z._Sakall 0 Szőke Szakáll (born Gärtner Sándor, 2 February 1883 – 12 February 1955), known in the English speaking world as S. Z. Sakall, was a Hungarian stage and film character actor. The name he went by, Szőke Szakáll, is Hungarian for blonde beard. He appeared in many films including Christmas in Connecticut (1945), In the Good Old Summertime (1949), Lullaby of Broadway (1951), and Casablanca (1942), in which he played Carl, the head waiter. Chubby-jowled Sakall played numerous supporting roles in Hollywood musicals and comedies in the 1940s and 1950s. His rotund cuteness caused studio head Jack Warner to bestow on Sakall the nickname "Cuddles". Warner asked that he be billed as S. Z. "Cuddles" Sakall in his later films, though he was never happy with the name. He became well known for using the phrase "everything is hunky dunky". Szőke_Szakáll ( born Gärtner_Sándor , 2_February_1883 – 12_February_1955 ) , known in the_English_speaking_world as S._Z._Sakall , was a_Hungarian_stage_and_film_character_actor . The_name he went by , Szőke_Szakáll , is Hungarian for blonde_beard . He appeared in many_films including Christmas in Connecticut ( 1945_) , In the_Good_Old_Summertime_(_1949_) , Lullaby of Broadway_(_1951_) , and Casablanca_(_1942_) , in which he played Carl , the_head_waiter . Chubby-jowled_Sakall played numerous_supporting_roles in Hollywood_musicals_and_comedies in the_1940s_and_1950s . His_rotund_cuteness caused studio_head_Jack_Warner to_bestow on Sakall the_nickname_"_Cuddles_" . Warner asked that he be_billed as S._Z._"_Cuddles_"_Sakall in his_later_films , though he was never_happy with the_name . He became well_known for using the_phrase " everything is hunky_dunky_" .
